reference: Faster algorithms for the shortest path problem
math_formula:
$$
\begin{aligned}
&\text{Minimize} && \sum_{(i,j) \in E} a_{i,j} \cdot x_{i,j} \\
&\text{Subject to} && \sum_{j \in N \mid (i,j) \in E} x_{i,j} - \sum_{k \in N \mid (k,i) \in E} x_{k,i} = b_i \quad \forall i \in N \\
& && x_{i,j} \in \{0, 1\} \quad \forall (i,j) \in E
\end{aligned}
$$
natural_language_example: Suppose you are planning a road trip from City A to City B. Each road between cities has a specific travel time (cost). The goal is to find the route from City A to City B that minimizes the total travel time. This is an example of the Shortest Path Problem, where cities are nodes, roads are arcs, and travel times are arc costs.
